name: 3,3,3-trifluoro-N-(1-methylpropyl)-2-(trifluoromethyl)propanamide
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-3479
Reason: 1-Methylpropyl group: The methylpropyl group introduces a rigid structure with increased molecular weight, estimated at around +5 to +10°C. The trifluoromethyl group introduces a significant dipole, increasing intermolecular forces and melting point by approximately +30°C. The fluorine atoms also contribute to the melting point due to their high electronegativity, estimated at around +10°C each. The ketone group introduces polar carbonyl interactions, contributing approximately +40°C. The methyl group reduces the melting point due to the reduced symmetry and increased molecular weight, estimated at around -10°C. The trifluoromethyl group's effect might be higher due to the increased molecular weight and van der Waals interactions, estimated at around +10°C. The fluorine atoms also contribute to the melting point due to their high electronegativity, estimated at around +10°C each.
